meanings.definition: To defeat in a fight or battle.
meanings.sent1: The brave knight managed to outfight the dragon and save the kingdom.
meanings.sent2: The skilled boxer was able to outfight his opponent and win the match.
meanings.sent3: The tiny mouse tried to outfight the cat in a playful game of tag.
meanings.sent4: She knew she had to outfight her fears to achieve her dreams.
meanings.sent5: The underdog team had to outfight the champions to claim victory.

meanings.sent1: The ninja was able to outfight all his opponents with his swift moves.
meanings.sent2: The experienced warrior could outfight any challenger who dared to face him.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel seemed to outfight the other animals in the acorn-gathering contest.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outfight her limitations led her to great success.
meanings.sent5: The superhero had to outfight the villain to protect the city from harm.
